definition: to raise/to dig up/to poke/to prick/to incite/to stir up
to carry on a shoulder pole/to choose/to pick/to nitpick

sentences.english: In the hall, the shallow challenger shall be allowed to swallow the swallows.
sentences.chinese: 在大厅里，浮浅得挑衅者将被容许吞下燕子。

sentences.english: He denounced the missile launch as provocative but made no sudden moves.
sentences.chinese: 他谴责导弹发射是种挑衅，但是并没有采取突然行动。

sentences.english: Nevertheless, Trotsky's book is a provocation.
sentences.chinese: 但是托洛斯基的书是一个挑衅。

sentences.english: Anson Chan decried the comments by Tsang as a "provocation and personal attack".
sentences.chinese: 陈方安生谴责曾德成的言论是挑衅及人身攻击。

sentences.english: The provocation this time can be regarded as an invasion of South Korean territory.
sentences.chinese: 李说:“这次挑衅可以被认为是对韩国领土的侵犯。

sentences.english: He slammed the door in a spirit of defiance.
sentences.chinese: 他以挑衅性的态度把门砰地一下关上。

sentences.english: Scattering the Chinese provokers with armoured vehicles.
sentences.chinese: 用装甲车驱散中国的挑衅者。

sentences.english: It converted the passive suffering of shame into energy, activity, aggression.
sentences.chinese: 这把羞愧的消极痛苦转变成了精力，活动和挑衅。

sentences.english: Instead, he sought to provoke a Japanese attack.
sentences.chinese: 相反，他应该挑衅让日本人先进攻。

sentences.english: Any such provocations cannot get away without due punishment.
sentences.chinese: 凡属这类挑衅都逃不脱应得的惩罚。

sentences.english: The Deputy Commander has condemned this weekend's protest as deliberate provocation.
sentences.chinese: 副指挥官谴责本周末的抗议活动是蓄意挑衅。

sentences.english: The Vietnamese have no illusions about Beijing's readiness to provoke.
sentences.chinese: 越南人对北京可能的挑衅并不抱有幻想。

sentences.english: The future will take tough measures, the DPRK did not dare to initiate provocations.
sentences.chinese: 今后将采取强硬措施，使朝鲜不敢再发起挑衅”。

sentences.english: Some of the border guards, who had patrolled the barrier day in day out, saw it as a provocation.
sentences.chinese: 一些日夜在此巡逻的边防兵，将这视为一种挑衅。

sentences.english: Because rock keeps silence which makes instigator don't know what to do with it.
sentences.chinese: 因为石头的静默令挑衅生事者无从入手。

sentences.english: Lu was provoked by the ever increasing construction sites in his country
sentences.chinese: 姚璐受到他国家里日益增加的建筑场地的挑衅。

definition: to fight back/to return fire/to counterattack
to demonstrate (as a protest)/a demonstration/a military show of force
to pick a quarrel/to start a fight
to play tricks on/to make fun of/to tease
hostile/malevolence/antagonism/to view as enemy/to stand against
